Description:
The FHIR DocumentReference resource describes information about a document.

The response of a Create depends on the prefer header:

  • Prefer: return=minimal
    • Returns the full URL to the resource in the Location header.
  • Prefer: return=representation
    • Returns both the full URL to the resource in the Location header, as well as the full FHIR resource in the response body. The FHIR resource format is identical to a response from DocumentReference.Read.

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the R4 DocumentReference resource.

attachment.Name: attachment
attachment.Description: Absolute reference to Binary FHIR resource in Content.attachment.content

data.Name: data
data.Description: The note string to save, encoded in base64.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter you are filing the note to. This must be a clinical encounter that can hold a note.

docStatus.Name: docStatus
docStatus.Description:
Epic supports the following values:

  • preliminary
  • final

Documents marked "preliminary" are given an incomplete status in Epic so that a clinician can review or edit the document before signing it in Epic. All other documents are assigned a "final" status, which is the default value, and corresponds to a value of "signed" in Epic.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient you are filing the note to.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
If the client knows the list of note types, they can send in the type as:

  • code= Note Type value from category list
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list

For example: "urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

The following LOINC codes are supported:

  • 11506-3: Progress Note
  • 11488-4: Consult Note
  • 28570-0: Procedure Note
  • 34117-2: H&P Note
  • 18842-5: Discharge Summary
  • 34111-5: ED Note
  • 69730-0: Patient Instructions
  • 34746-8: Nursing Note

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the R4 DocumentReference resource.

authenticator.Name: authenticator
authenticator.Description: Who or what authenticated the document.

attachment.Name: attachment
attachment.Description: Absolute reference to Binary FHIR resource in Content.attachment.content

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI where the data can be found.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The context of the document content.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The time of the service that is being documented.

date.Name: date
date.Description: When this document reference was created.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The note identifier from the Epic system.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient that is the subject of the note.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note type.

Can be in the format:

  • code= Note Type value from category list INP 5010
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list INP 5010
  • For example: "urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

The following LOINC codes are supported:

  • 11506-3: Progress Note
  • 11488-4: Consult Note
  • 28570-0: Procedure Note
  • 34117-2: H&P Note
  • 18842-5: Discharge Summary
  • 34111-5: ED Note
  • 69730-0: Patient Instructions
  • 34746-8: Nursing Note
